
```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
set.seed(121204)

# Random parameters
ytm <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.03, sd = 0.002)         # yield to maturity (~3%)
rf  <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.015, sd = 0.001)        # risk-free rate (~1.5%)
mkt <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.08, sd = 0.005)         # market risk premium (~8%)
beta_d <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.10, sd = 0.02)       # debt beta (~0.10)

spread <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.005, sd = 0.001)     # credit spread (~0.5%)
loss_rate <- 0.60                                # loss given default

# Two approaches
ret_loss = ytm - spread * loss_rate
ret_capm = rf + beta_d * mkt


```

Aurora Technologies issued 10-year bonds with the following characteristics:

- Yield to maturity (YTM) = `r round(ytm*100,2)`%
- Credit spread (BBB-like default rate) = `r round(spread*100,2)`%
- Risk-free rate = `r round(rf*100,2)`%
- Market risk premium = `r round(mkt*100,1)`%
- Estimated debt beta = `r round(beta_d,2)`
- Expected loss rate in default = 60%
